meanings.definition: A group of cyclists riding closely together in a race.
meanings.sent1: During the race, the pelotons of cyclists zoomed past the cheering crowd.
meanings.sent2: The pelotons of cyclists maneuvered skillfully around the sharp turns of the course.
meanings.sent3: The pelotons of cyclists looked like a colorful snake winding through the countryside.
meanings.sent4: As the pelotons of cyclists raced, they resembled a synchronized dance on wheels.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pelotons of cyclists speeding by was etched in the spectators' minds.

meanings.definition: A group of soldiers or police officers.
meanings.sent1: The pelotons of soldiers marched in perfect unison during the parade.
meanings.sent2: The police officers formed pelotons to maintain order during the protest.
meanings.sent3: The pelotons of soldiers stood at attention, looking like toy soldiers in formation.
meanings.sent4: The pelotons of police officers moved swiftly to contain the unruly crowd.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the pelotons of soldiers instilled a sense of security in the citizens.

meanings.definition: A group of people with a common interest or purpose.
meanings.sent1: In the library, the pelotons of book lovers gathered for the reading club.
meanings.sent2: The pelotons of volunteers worked tirelessly to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The pelotons of gamers huddled around the screen, strategizing their next move.
meanings.sent4: The pelotons of protesters marched together, chanting for change.
meanings.sent5: The unity within the pelotons of activists was palpable during the rally.
